Most Illustrious Sir

The government again reiterates to Your Lordship that of the 22nd of last month, which was addressed to you in a circular of the same date, and recommends that you very positively order the police commanders of your department to never allow any individual, whoever they may be, to transit therein without being provided with the proper passport, under the severest responsibility, which Your Lordship

God preserve Your Lordship Caçapava, March 6, 1840 Most Illustrious Sir Inácio José de Oliveira Guimarães. Serafim Joaquim de Alencastre

Office of the Excellent, March 6, received on the 20th of the same [month].
